caption: Very nice atmosphere.
Enjoyed a romantic night out.  Food was great.  Service was spectacular.  Highly recommend the kale and spinach.  And the French martini :)
Surely a place worth visiting, the food is fantastic and well prepared, the rates are convenient and it is constantly neat here. Great work.
i can say this place does it for me. feels similar to a cafe in chicago i loved.
Service is excellent even when they are busy. The staff was sociable and attentive. Prices were appropriate.
I was super full. There was fast, efficient, and courteous service. Menu is like a cafe in Boston I loved.

We loved this place years ago and still love it just as much today. Excellent service and excellent choice of steaks and sides. Very clean and the staff is exceptional. Outstanding wines too!! Very elegant and extremely clean.  Highly recommend.
i wanted to post a food pic but it looked so good i couldn't stop. will surely make a return trip. the bill was reasonable i would say.
the staff was very welcoming and sociable. prices are decent. i see why this place has a lot of great reviews.
God Bless Shula's steak house. It's been around since I was born in 84, and my father would take me every year for my birthday from 10-15 years old. Greatest memories with my father.
Great dining experience!
Great dinner! Great service! Celebrated our anniversary. They gave us complimentary dessert.
Food was good, mediocre service
greatly superior food and service highly recommend
The steak is always unbeatable and delicious!  Service was supreme as always as well! Cannot say enough good things! The creme brulee was superlative! Definitely recommend!
I wish I could give Shula's 10 stars! The food and atmosphere were great and so was our server Samantha! I highly recommend Shula's Steak House!
Overall good service, food, drinks.. the sour doughb bread was amazing lol
Great dining experience for Christmas night! ❤❤❤
Great service, timely, and delicious food!
Excellent steakhouse. you get what you pay for. Al carte sides but large enough for two to share. Great place to go for a celebration.
Great steak unbelievable service

Shula's is not the steakhouse it used to be. My mother lives in New England and used to love coming to Shula's whenever she would visit Florida. So when she was in town I suggested we go there for dinner. Although it was a Monday, the restaurant was completely empty at 7:00 PM. I was beside myself! I cut Shula's some slack because it was right after Thanksgiving weekend. We sat at a very nice table. The wine by the glass list is extremely generic. Do they have a reserve wine list? We weren't presented one. I am a sommelier by profession and would have appreciated better wine than what I can find at Publix or even CVS. The menus were stained and some pages had tears in them. It was sad. That and the fact that the restaurant was dead should have been our signals to turn around and go somewhere else. We split a 16 oz NY Strip, potatoes au gratin, and brussel sprouts. The steak was cooked properly (medium rare), but it was flavorless and it wasn't juicy. Also - $48 for ANGUS BEEF?? Are you kidding me?! That is outrageous, especially for a mediocre steak. The potatoes au gratin were horrible. Undercooked, grainy in texture, and drowned in a lukewarm cheese sauce. We should have sent it back. Also very overpriced for $11. We each had just one bite and that was all we could handle. The brussel sprouts were good, but for $10 they should be the best I've ever had and they were far from that. The last time I ate here was in 2013 and it was incredible. The restaurant was full, the atmosphere was vibrant, and the food was delicious. I really can't believe Shula's is still in business. The only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is because Neal provided very good service. My mother has always asked for him over the years and he is very friendly and professional. But this time my mother and I agreed we will not go back to Shula's again.

Very disappointed, its been 10 years since we have been there. Back then service was Excellent and the food was superb! Comparable to Berns. But not anymore. Service sub par and food not cooked to our liking. Steaks undercooked almost raw we ordered medium. Sent them back twice. Chief came out twice, but I could tell he wasn’t well trained. The Chief we had 10 yrs ago was trained at Berns. Such a shame it was our 30th wedding anniversary and my wife’s favorite special place to go. She was disappointed. But I guess nothing stays the same. I know Don Shula would not be happy with this Shula’s.

Went there for my wifes birthday..first of all I was alarmed that there was no one there on a saturday night and all other restaurant were packed. Well I found out why, the food was really really bad and the service was bad, and the over all look of the restaurant was plain, if you want to see how it is done and the way it should be, go to the one in orlando...stay away from this one in tampa.
There was plastic in my fish. It took nearly an hour to get a refund. I am going to bed hungry and irritated. I will NEVER eat here again.

Fantastic food.  Over the top experience for my husband's birthday.  We enjoyed a wonderful dinner, steaks, tender, aged and cooked to perfection, sides are delectable, be sure to get the asparagus and lobster mac and cheese. Caution: the sour dough bread is so fresh and hot it will do you in and ruin your appetite...go easy.
Guy who served us was kind of weird to us idk. but the food was amazing.
Expensive but outstanding
We come every year for special occasions and NEVER disappoint... thanks to our waiter Gary to make the night so special!
I love my steaks and I love Shula's.

My friend and I couldn't get a reservation at Bern's Steakhouse, so I looked up other restaurants in Tampa, and came up with Shula's on Kennedy Blvd. She ordered a ribeye steak and I ordered a Porterhouse steak with a twice baked potato. I had barbecued shrimp for an appetizer, and she had lobster bisque.  Our maitr'd was a man named Paul who made suggestions that were REALLY incredible. I would have to say that this was the best steak I have eaten in a LONG time!
Great Steaks
Excellent steaks and service. Their steaks are better than Bern's.
Service, awful. Food, mediocre. Price, unbelievably high.  Hardly anyone there on a Saturday night. Now I know why.
The steak is better than Ruth's Chris. Now it is a close #1 with Charley's steak as a #2. Service was great. They have valet parking as well.

Gary and Gerald were fantastic servers for our birthday meal! Very attentive and the meal was delicious! Steaks were cooked to a perfect rare temperature and the sides were amazing as well! We got the crab mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. Took every bit of leftovers home with us! Thank you for a great experience!
(Translated by Google) Very good food  (Original) Muy buena la comida
Nothing wrong with it. Just value wise and quality of food...I'd take Bern's or Ruth's any day of the week

I had a perfect breakfast service here. Everything was still fresh. Looked good and tasted great too. Free refills on the coffee and juice and lots of fresh fruit. Perfect start for the day for only 15usd. Situated in the Westshore Grand Hotel. Recommended!
Food was good, eerily quiet for a Friday night
Food was really good. Our server was very attentive and great personality. However, all servers should realize that one non-smiling server with a grumpy demeanor could change the whole atmosphere.
Great steaks
Service was ok. Scallops were great
Great experience, superb service, best steaks in Tampa.   Wedge salad and potatoes au gratin are both amazing too.

What a disappointment. I've been to many steak houses. The $15.00 shrimp cocktail was four 25 count shrimp on a flat plate. No ice. The sauce was good. The shrimp didn't have a crisp shiny finish and were not cold. My $52.00 filet was not cooked Pittsburg medium rare as I ordered. It didn't really look to be more than eight ounces. It was done medium. The bloody Mary was properly spiced but I wanted a celery stick. The waiter brought me some slivers in a dish after I reminded him when he brought my second Mary with olives. I won't be back.
Great food great service in an iconic dining facility.
Foods still great but not the hotspot it use to be
Phenomenal steak.

The ambiance is nice, typical of a high end restaurant.  The service was pretty good and fairly on par with the prices. Could have been better but acceptable.  We started with the appetizers. The Calamari was not bad at all, call it a 7 out of 10. It was cook well, seemed like good quality.  The crab cake was another story. It was priced and presented like fine dining. By that I mean, one crab cake for $20. Again, this is expected but what wasn’t expected was the taste and quality. Not sure how it was made specifically but my guess is frozen crab parts mixed with a stouffers type store bought stuffing and a foul mixture of seasonings.  Then the meal came, we all had the ‘mixed grill’ for variety.  Where to I begin with this $45 monstrosity. It was presented fine dining, by that I mean small portions, too hot plate (normal for fine dining and always stupid. Please stop doing that fine restaurants, please.) and of course the price, minus the sides.  I had the Filet Medallions, Maui Maui and BBQ Shrimp.  The beef seemed like Grade B meat. It was worse than what I would expect on an airplane, couch class. It was cooked perfectly at medium rare but was dry and tasteless.  Actually there was a bit of taste but I’m being kind omitting that in my original description.  Had I had this steak on the Golden Corral Buffett I would have been disappointed.  The Maui Maui was crazy small, maybe 2-3 oz which turned out to be a blessing in disguise. It tasted like it was microwaved.  But the true disgrace of the show was the BBQ Shrimp. I appeared to be a medium quality frozen bacon wrapped shrimp literally dipped in a store bought BBQ sauce. And I’m not even talking like a Stubbs level sauce. This was like a can of BBQ sauce from the discount bin. Never seen canned BBQ sauce? Me either but now I’m convince it must exist.  The sides, which all cost extra of course, where thoughtless low quality fairs.  I don’t want to complain on the people. We had good service and were treated as expected. And honesty, I think everything was actually cooked as well as it could be. It was just super low quality stuff.  And I’m not talking low quality for fine dining. I’m talking low quality period. I can easily do better at 2am with the munchies throwing stuff together from my refrigerators, about to expire selection.  Just avoid this place unless you hate your money and more importantly hate yourself and those you’re with.
Mashed potatoes with Filet!!
Great service, fabulous food. Don't believe me? Go see for yourself. 🍷🥩🥣🥗
Terrific food and service!

I had the most amazing experience here. Not because of the food - let’s be honest steak is steak.  But the service was incredible. Sam and Jimmy deliver an experience at the hotel lobby bar that is unparalleled and will impress the most critical customer.  Samantha understands how to serve a customer and make their dining or drinking experience magical. I’d recommend this place to anyone looking To have fun or entertain a client.   Just do it.

Whatever you do while staying at the Westshore, Tampa skip breakfast at Shulas. Their idea of toast is either wheat bread with frozen butter or burnt wheat bread with drawn butter. Extremely overpriced for the quality and service. Stick to ordering steak. Skip the breakfast.

1st of all Shula's is a Tampa institution. Everyone should try it at some point. However, this time it was just alright. The food was good. The servers were super nice. I just feel like I should have left the place a little more excited. It just wasn't really THAT great.  Look, don't get me wrong, everything was okay and the people were friendly. I just feel like I probably could have had the same experience at Flemmings for a couple hundred less. We'll be back, we'll try it again. I just hope next time they do something to stand out.

It was a disaster. The service was so poor there were times when we actually had to raise our hand to be waited on. It was my fiancé’s birthday and we hated EVERY minute here.  The only thing that was decent was valet. Ha! So sad,the tablecloths on the tables are sooooooo long and in the way that you cant slide in or out of the booth without dragging it. He nor I are overweight and it was silly to have to navigate your table just to get up.  No diversity and very inconvenient location with a stuffy crowd. Its not a hip place like it sounds or looks online and I will never go back. In fact, I’d like to forget we went. Thanks Shulas for horrible food and service from me to my fiancé on his birthday. Yea, we should have just got the free 1/4 chicken meal from Pollo Tropical LOL. SHAMEFUL. Tampa location. Not San Francisco.
I had a great grouper over a cheesy risotto. I also liked the ambiance. The staff could’ve been nicer, though.
Nothing extraordinary; my visits to other Shula's have been much better. Disappointed.

Place was ok, needs some updates. Service was good at first but then, the waiter charged us twice and now I have to dispute one of then charges;  plus it took him forever to come back and give us our check. The food let me unimpressed. My fish was dry and my husband steak was plane. Not coming back.

Ate at Shula's and wanted to spoil myself. Got the mixed grill (filet medallions - medium rare, salmon with mango salsa, and crab cake); sauteed spinach, and caramelized Brussels sprouts with bacon and onion.  The steak had a faint liver taste; could have been as a result of the cut. The salmon was acceptable - nothing special but tasty. The crab cake was excellent. The spinach, sauteed with garlic and olive oil, was also fine. The Brussels sprouts had a good initial flavor, but were extremely greasy *see photo below of grease in the to go container after leaving the restaurant*.  I expected a fabulous dinner for the $70+ fee, but was disappointed at the majority of the dishes. At least the server was good and the crab cake tasty.
Servers outstanding!  Food outstanding!
(Translated by Google) The food is very fat, and very expensive  (Original) La comida tiene mucha grasa,  y en muy cara
You can't go wrong with steak at Shula's. Everything here is expensive as you might have guessed but worth it.
Shula's in Tampa was fantastic, slow night, we had 2 waiters. Steaks and appetizers, sides, drinks and dessert. Absolutely everything was superb. Service beyond expectations. Five stars all around

Our party of four went to Shulas on New Year's Eve. We were seated at 6:30 and did not get our food until 8:00 pm. The restaurant was not packed at this time yet we still received sub-par service. Our steaks were just average. Other Shula's locations have set  high standards which were not here.
Thank you
I was impressed with the staff and the food is exceptional.  We ate in the private dining.  Highly recommend Shula's Steak House
Best place for a steak hands down. Went there with my girlfriend and it didn’t disappoint. Great steak, service, and ambiance.

Had Thanksgiving Dinner with friends! Neil and Gil were phenomenal waiters! It was a prefixe menu and had Amazing butternut squash! Price was perfect for the amount of food and courses. The alcohol prices were appropriate for an upscale restaurant and hotel/bar. I think it would have been nice to have had one cocktail included with the meal since many restaurants offered this option. However, this is a very small suggestion considering how amazing the service and the food was!  Recommend anyone who goes to make a reservation as it does get packed there from time to time with hotel guests!
Great Staff Great Food Shared With #Great Friends. Twice a Year we have Breakfast Birthday Celebrations here. Never Disappointed
Wasn't worth the cost 1-8 oz steak was $46! Can get same thing at outback for much less, food was good though.
Shula's food never disappoints!
Amazing food and friendly service.
Service and the food was excellent, a little pricey but will worth it,
Solid option if staying at the hotel. The service is exceptional.
Good food and good staff
Was not impressed at all steak was  rancid. Took forever to get the steak out
Food was excellent and the service was great!  Paul & Ali were terrific!
Bad night
Get the filet!

I was in Tampa with some colleagues for work and we decided to stop at Shula's for lunch. This is the first time I had been to one (it's a chain). I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The restaurant was nice and open and modern. It had several different types of seatings from comfortable high tops to smaller tables with comfortable large chairs. Since I had really eaten a lot the night before, I decided to take a break and ordered the Club Shula Sandwich with steak fries (don't judge me).  The club and the fries were both really good. The club consisted of ham, maple glazed turkey, smoked bacon and cheddar served on ciabatta bread. It was delicious. The bacon was particularly well done. It was crispy without being burned the way bacon should be. The steak fries were also superior. Lately, the fries I have been getting from restaurants tend to be too thick, taste more like potatoes and are often undercooked. None of this was an issue with Shula's steak fries. They were perfectly cooked and had just the right combination of thickness and crunchiness. I put the fries out on the table so everyone could have some and they didn't last long.  Overall, I was very happy with Shula's. For a chain the food and setting were both very good and I would easily recommend this place to others.
The food was not good at all ,barbeque shrimp lavered in sauce and scallops were raw asparagus was super hard and crab cake was completely dry and over cooked till it was dry .
I have always loved eating at this place. I got the Filet and lobster and was amazed by how good it was. Prices are a little high in comparison to Berns Steakhouse.

Wonderful food and service. We stopped at the bar before we were seated for dinner. The food is amazing and I'd love to go back. I had a steak, lobster tail, mushrooms and crab mac and cheese. Personally I think the steak was better than Berns in Tampa.
Great service. Thanks Kaitlyn.
Great food

Amazing steaks, delicious mac and cheese, and paired well with the mushrooms. I think it's better than Berns food wise. Desert was the chocolate lava cake with ice-cream. Great service and will be back!
Average.fish was over cook.service was ok.
Food was excellent and service was topnotch!

Went here for Mother’s Day dinner. Ordered the filet mignon rare. Temp was perfect but they forgot the seasoning. No salt no pepper, served with a hollandaise sauce which was watered and runny. May have been to some likings although I personally didn’t care for it all. Mashed potatoes were nothing special. Good but just plain old mashed potatoes. Again a bit bland. Asparagus as cooked perfectly and the best thing about the dinner. Dinner came with chocolate cake which was great. The damn good chocolate cake and asparagus were not worth $55. Over all not impressed. My husband ordered off the regular menu and paid À la cart sides and said it was great.

I just ordered a chicken sandwich from SHULAS STEAK HOUSE Westshore & Kennedy in Tampa Florida  the piece of chicken was tiny the bun was twice the size of the chicken and it came to $18.00 the Website said the chicken sandwich was $9.00 false advertising the manager said sorry you cant go by the Website it hasn't been updated in a few years, totally not worth it
Extremely good meal especially the Coyboy Ribeye. But be prepared to spend some hard earned money.
Great food and service was awesome. Also met Shula that night.
Love this place. Neil the waiter is phenomenal.
Waited over an hour to be served - no service. The waitress took the order of other people who arrived 5 minutes ago but did not follow up with me.

Went to Shula’s really late with my husband, to celebrate our birthdays after a friend’s recommendation. This location is located within a hotel, I don’t know if all locations are like that but I will get to the reason I am mentioning this further in my post. The meat was terrible, way over cooked and the service was not the best, perhaps because we were the only ones there as what appeared to be a very bad day for the restaurant. At the end we get our bill and we were force to pay a tip that was indicated on the bill that is normally added to those who stay at the hotel.  Since we were not staying at the hotel I argued this,  then we were told that because we used a promotional price that was the requirement. Promotional price or not your management should be a shamed of doing that to a customer. Do not advertise promotions if you are going to hit a customer with an obscene tip amount. In any case if you are undecided you can go ahead and pass on this place as I have had better steak than that.  Certainly not worth the price and the meat that was presented at the entrance was not at all what I got on my plate.
I refuse to touch any steak that does not come from Shula's!! Anyone who could leave a low rating... must have tried to propose and suffered, "No!" for the answer!!
Quiet, elegant and outstanding steak.
I really wanted this place to be great!!  The steak was fair and not cooked well.  Asked for it medium and it came like it saw in a wam pot for hours. For the price it should be better.

I attended a private event at the Westshore catered by Shula's.  Everything was a 5 out of 5.  The seafood appetizers, the tenderloin cooked to perfection and the chocolate cake for dessert.  Everyone talked about the great meal and the friendly staff all night and into the next day.  They are world famous for a reason.  Well worth a visit even if you aren't staying at the hotel.
Best place ever

This hidden gem is a solid meat and potatoes place that is quiet, courteous and elegant. Our server Ali was especially thoughtful and I’m glad we had the pleasure of his service. We had the cowboy ribeye and the filet mignon trio, crab Mac n cheese, potato gratin and ceasar salad. All solid food.  My only complaint is that it is incredibly unoriginal and will charge $10 for a generic ceasar salad and $10 for steamed asparagus. I get the shareable concept but that’s absurd. For $200 a meal for two I’d expect to be at a chefs table trying gelled and foamed experiments, not classic meat and veggies. Also, I’ve paid less for a better view. I would have expected this place to be atop the building encased by windows and city views.  The place was established in 1990s and in my opinion, stuck there. There is something to be said for tried and true, however, and this place does not disappoint if you wanna over splurge on simple good food.

Neil was outstanding. The service was excellent. He obviously has a significant amount of knowledge about the menu items. The steak was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. It was very tender and definitely aged, but I have to admit that I prefer dry aging to wet aging. The sides were well seasoned and very good, with the exception of the mashed potatoes. The quantity is definitely a lot for one person, and they arrived just at the lowest temperature that I would consider to be safe for serving hot food, which meant that by the end they were cold and had the consistency of paste. Also, I would have been fine with lowering the item cost and cutting the portion size for that particular item. For dessert, there is not much selection for someone with a gluten allergy aside from the wide variety of items from the bar, so I went with the ice cream. Again the portion was quite large for one person, so proportionally cutting back on cost and size would have been appreciated. Overall, the best parts of the meal were the conversation about the aging process and the side of sauteed mushrooms. I do my own dry aging thanks to a very high-tech kitchen, so even though on objective qualities the steak was perfect dry aging has a much more beefy flavor.

Excellent Service.  The service exceeded the food.  Cowboy Ribeye was standard but not spectacular.  Brussels Sprouts were fairly mundane.  The chocolate souffle was amazing!  Screaming toddlers made a dent in the ambience.
Amazing quality, the food is great, The  atmosphere is great, the staff is super friendly and the drinks were great
It was great it always is so I keep coming back, nuff said...
Excellent service.  Filet Mignon outstanding.

Of course the steaks are good. Breakfast options offer buffet or meal. Staff is quite accommodating and the chefs will prepare what you want. Nice quiet place in the morning usually while traveling. Restaurant sits in the back of the hotel lobby, pass the bar, so it seems more quiet.

Saw the amazing reviews and decided to do breakfast/ brunch while I waited for my room to become available.  I arrived at approx 11:20 am on  a Sunday (They closed for breakfast at 11:30) and were kind enough to squeeze me in. Unfortunately for another guests who came less than 2 minutes behind me, the hostess wasn't so accommodating. I for one think it's rather bad business to turn away money and close up early but hey.  So my order arrives, a Belgian waffles with a side of berries and bacon . I noticed the blueberries were cooked in the waffle and there were no strawberries which was not was not what I wanted but I shrugged it off thinking it couldn't be that bad .  The waiter realized this error and  brought back my berries on the side.  It was then, when I actually cut into the waffle, that i realized ALL l the berries had been cooked inside the waffle,  and the waffle itself half cooked.  To their credit, it was taken off with no apology and rather dismissively. The overall service left a genuinely bad taste in my mouth.... almost as bad as the waffle. Oh I did get free berries also and the primary waiter was pretty nice

Oh my GOSH!!!! This place was soooooo amazing!!! 1st of all the place was beautiful and the food was out of this world! We had the Burrata salad, Cesar salad, the Cowboy Ribeye steak with grilled asparagus and augratin potatoes, and a chocolate souffle with vanilla ice cream that was simply amazing!!!! I'll be back for sure:)!

Food is always awesome and Gary makes sure we are well taking care of every time. I highly recommend Shulas. My wide and I started going to Shulas about a year ago and it beats any prior dining experience by far.
My favorite steak restaurant. If you go there ask for the server Paul tell him JT sent you. You will get great service as always.
EXCELLENT STEAK, really the best in the area.  THE MOST tender meat.  The desserts are fabulous, too.  I highly recommend this restaurant.
Breakfast buffet and service was excellent.
Nice place to eat. Bit pricey

Shula's is self described as a "Celebration of the '72 Dolphins undefeated season." when the reality is more akin to the winless seasons of '76 Bucaneers or '08 Lions.  When paying a premium for a meal, in particularly at a restaurant that prices itself as a "high-end" restaurant I believe it is fair to expect a certain degree of service and food quality. Unfortunately I found both to be lacking.  My party attended Shula's for Christmas Eve Dinner and consisted of seven adults and four children. Our reservation was for a private dining room and the restaurant was perhaps 1/3 full.  To begin with, perhaps our server was new, which would seem odd to let him handle a private party solo, but it is the only explanation I can conceive of at this moment for the service or lack thereof. Apart from smelling like a smokestack and disappearing for long periods of time (I can only assume smoke breaks) he somehow managed to bring a soft drink to a guest who arrived fifteen minutes after everyone else but somehow neglected to bring drinks that had been ordered by the rest of the party upon their arrival.  The next adventures occurred when the entrees were served. Despite being a private party, in a private dining room in a 1/3 full restaurant, a meal went missing. Somehow the wait staff had taken the order of one of our party and sent it to another table in the main restaurant.  This error was rapidly followed by an additional faux pas. A different member of the party had ordered a steak well done. Now while I may take umbrage with ruining a good steak in this manner, nonetheless, the temperature requested was well done. The steak arrived and it was medium rare and promptly sent back. Not even close to well done. Five minutes later they bring the steak out and it didn't look different at all. At this point in time it wouldn't have surprised me if they had tried to microwave it...I as that surprised by the incompetence.  I personally ordered a medium-rare New York Strip which was cooked correctly but the quality was more in line with Outback or Appelebee's as opposed to a good steakhouse.  I do want to give credit where credit is due. The sides were good: Seared Ahi Tuna, Sourdough Bread, Green Beans and Steak Fries (huge basket) were what I would expect based on the cost of the meal.  Ultimately, if you are looking for a real steakhouse and a good dining experiencing I strongly suggest Bern's, Charley's or any high end steakhouse that is NOT Shula's.
Best steak in town!
They understood what "blue rare" was... the first time!! Strongly recommend this spot for a good steak.
Food was absolutely delicious!
Really decent high end steakhouse. Not the best in Tampa but still really good.
excellent old fashioned steakhouse,
Excellent

Still to this date, despite international travel, the Best Steak I have ever had. Very surprised to find it in a back water quiet hotel but it was just superbe. Amazing quality produce, excellent staff, just outstanding
The Shula cut the best beef money can buy
Always delish. Love the lobster tails, lobster bisque and steaks!
Great steak and service!
Best restaurant, best food, delicious dessert awesome customer service. It's unbelievable. I will definitely repeat it a million times.

The food was cold, and the service was abysmal. Our waiter appeared only once during our meal to check on us, and we felt rushed to order. If you're charging 50 dollars  for an ala carte steak, you need to do a lot better than that!  We were very disappointed.
They don't use real eggs. They use liquid eggs.

My family and I had Sunday brunch at Shula's. They had all sorts of items: 2 different types of scrambled eggs, several difference bread and croissant options, quiche options, bacon & sausage, cheese and meat platter, fruit platters, yogurt options, cereal, etc. Lots of good choices and everything tasted great. Our serve Ricky had outstanding customer service.

on saturday august 9,2014 myself and family dined at shulas..  we were celebrating my 50th birthday!!!  i ordered the ribeye medium asked for spicey seasoning and to be pittsburghed at the end of cooking...this does not sound hard for a steakhouse of this caliber.... got my steak and no seasoning and no flavor at all!!!.. took it back and replaced with a porterhouse same way cooked.. got steak and wow so dry... no juice on the plate at all!!!  we ordered au gratin potatoes they were awfull!!!   oh the bill was $ 250.00 with my steak taken off!!! thats for 3 adults and one child...  i would not even give one star but did not have the option!! longhorn has a better steak and i have been to las vegas steak houses way better than shulas no where near the crazy price!!!

We were staying at the hotel for our anniversary, and when the other restaurant that we had reservations at did not seem like what we wanted, we came here. So glad we did, even without making reservations, they made the night very special.  The food was very good, steaks were done to perfection and the atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for.... quiet & cozy & romantic!!!  We loved it.
(Translated by Google) Ruth chris taste half price  (Original) ruth chris 味道 一半价格

Fantastic food and service on new year's eve! There was a little issue on our part with valet and they even gave us a round of free drinks! What great service and food. Steak was cooked perfect and so were the sides. Would visit again

If the steak arrives without any visible searing as all three did on the last visit, then this eatery deserves no more attention and certainly not at these prices. There is a reason for the best steak houses' use of ultra high temp broilers. No evidence of that here other than the misuse of same if indeed the devices exist at all in the kitchen. Not worthy of a second chance from this reviewer.

My husband and I went here for our 19th wedding anniversary!  The service was BEYOND excellent!  They knew it was our anniversary and they went ABOVE and BEYOND!!  The food was SO good!  If you have not been you MUST go!
Good was good, but I think a bit overpriced. Guess the price hike is typical of restaurants in hotels.
